RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 44. Maiden Claiming Purse 19500. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BONNIE'S BEST was away alertly and dueled on the early lead for a half, shook clear in the stretch and remained safe late under firm handling. OHIO LADY tracked three wide, finished willingly and was second best. WICKED REESE chased the winner on the inside and went evenly late. LADYBUGGIN raced between horses early and faded in the stretch. AUGMENTING ASSETS settled early and was no threat.

ENTRY.COMMENT: chased tghe winner on the inside and went evenly late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 17600. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE OCTOBER 12. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 12 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BISCAYNE BAY raced between horses early, rallied in the stretch three wide, drew off late under firm handling. NORTHERN JOURNEY had good position on the inside, altered course in mid stretch, rallied and was second best. NOT A WILD BRAT set the pace and dueled on the lead, faltered in late stretch. SARAH JANE chased the early speed, rallied at the quarter pole and drew even, faded late. SWEET EMPIRE allowed to settle, failed to menace. DYNA'S HOLIDAY had an awkward start and was outrun.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 94. Starter Allowance Purse 17000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS IN THE LAST 5 STARTS. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 12 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Consi dered In Weight Allowances) (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AUGER was away alertly and quickly made the lead, led throughout and widened late under strong handling. KREWE CHIEF had good position early, was no match for the winner late but held place. QUESTION AUTHORITY had good position on the inside and went evenly late. LAUDA SPEED raced between horses early, steadied at the three eights pole, then was no threat. CHACO SPIRIT allowed to settle, failed to menace. THE DRAKE was no factor. MY BROTHER CAM pressed the pace three wide and was through after a half.

Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 12 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances ) (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CALLMEMARTHAJANE had good position while three wide, rallied in the stretch and drew close, edged clear late under strong handling. SLICKSNEAKYANDFAST set the pace with a clear lead, was hooked in mid stretch, held grudgingly and just missed. ENCHANTEDLY raced four wide and had a mild bid. PROTOMAGIC was unhurried early and was no threat late. BIZZY GIRL had good position on the inside and lacked a late response. GOSHEN contended for five eights and tired on the far turn. WILDCAT DREAM was wide early and trailed.

RACE.FOOTNOTES: PLAYING FOR KEEPS set the pace and was well handled on the front, remained clear in mid stretch, was roused late to stay clear. NOSEY POWER had good position on the inside, angled out three wide in the stretch, finished well and was second best. SOL OF VAQUERO had good position on the inside and went evenly late. MUSIC GEM had good position on the inside and was no threat. DANES HEART had good position early while four wide and lacked a late bid. TRANSPIRED chased the winner and faltered in the stretch. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 12 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NO TWOWAYSABOUTIT tracked three wide, rallied at the quarter pole and drew close, prevailed after a long stretch battle in a game effort. SONNET chased the early speed, rallied at the quarter pole and drew even, held grudgingly after a long stretch duel and just missed. ABIGAIL LEE had good position on the inside, angled out four wide in the stretch and finished well. NICEASAKITTENSEYES was never far back, swung wide in the stretch and had mild bid. PARFAIT hopped at the start and was outrun. WHERETHERE'SSMOKE set the pace for three quarters, then gave way in the stretch.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 7 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 89. Allowance Purse 25900. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR OHIO BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 12 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where En tered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances) (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TO WIN chased the early speed, rallied at the quarter pole, drew off in the stretch under firm handling to win as much the best .WILD OX had good position early, rallied at the quarter pole and drew even, was no match late for the winner but was second best. TAMANRASSETT set the early pace for five eights and gradually weakened. BOLD VICTORY was allowed to settle, improved late while no threat. SILENCE was unhurried early, saved ground and was no threat. WEEKENDER raced close up for three quarters, then gave way. GARRETT contended early and was through after a half. NOT SO EASY raced wide and was outrun.

Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 12 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances ).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: HIDDEN ACCESS dueled early, shook clear down the backside, widened in the stretch under left handed urging. CONTROLLER had good position, early, rallied at the quarter pole, was no match late for the winner.. SWEET JILL'S JACK tracked three wide early, angled in stretch and finished evenly. INDY CARR raced mid pack saved ground and was no threat. BRONZE KETTLE was unhurried early, passed tiring rivals while no menace. THE GOSPEL OF MARK saved ground and was no menace.
